properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 1 at 2:51PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
A storm system will bring much colder temperatures, high winds,
and snow to the Land of Enchantment on Monday and Tuesday. Strong
to damaging winds will arrive first, and impact areas near and
south of I-40 as well as the Chuska Mountains. Gusts between 50
and 70 mph are possible. Meanwhile, a potent cold front will
arrive Monday afternoon. Temperatures will plummet across
northwest New Mexico Monday afternoon and through the remainder of
the state Monday night and early Tuesday morning as the front
plunges southward. High temperatures on Tuesday will struggle to
reach the freezing mark for many locations. Very cold temperatures
will persist into Wednesday as well. Snow will favor northern and
western New Mexico Monday night through Tuesday. The heaviest
snow amounts are expected across the Northern Mountains where up
to 10 to 12 inches of snow is possible. 1 to 3 inches will be
common at lower elevations of the west and north.

Anyone planning travel in New Mexico Monday and Tuesday should be
prepared to encounter adverse weather conditions. Monitor NOAA
weather radio, weather.gov/abq or your local media for the latest
weather updates. For the latest New Mexico road conditions visit
nmroads.com or call 5-1-1.

NWSheadline: BIG CHANGES ON THE WAY MONDAY AND TUESDAY
